title: ERPs web app
shortDescription: A simple and reliable ERP system for a local Uruguayan company.
fullDescription:
Jardines del Cortijo is a real estate development project in Uruguay, specifically a residential “barrio jardín” (garden neighborhood) located about 5 minutes from the center of Florida, Uruguay.

It’s designed as a residential community with lots around 300 m² in size, set in a tranquil, green environment intended to offer families a quieter lifestyle near urban services.

ERP work I implemented:

  • Clients management
  • Financed-spaces creation and contract details
  • Payments upload and management
  • Automatic arrears calculation
  • Excel export and accounting documents generation
  • Revenew projection documents and automatic required business documents generation
  • Full history of changes and user accountability for actions

And more.

title: b2b E-Commerce for a local distributor
shortDescription: A simple but effective b2b e-commerce for a pharmacy products distributor
fullDescription:
Distribuidora Luna is a pharmacy products distributor based in Uruguay that managed a large network of pharmacies as clients. As the business grew, the company began facing challenges in keeping up with purchase orders and coordinating logistics efficiently.

To address these issues, I designed and developed a web-based e-commerce platform that enabled the company to centrally manage products, clients, and purchase orders. The platform allowed pharmacies to access a dedicated web portal through managed user accounts and place orders directly online. All new orders were instantly reflected and notified in an administrative dashboard, significantly improving response times and order tracking.

In addition, since the company relied on an on-street salesperson who regularly visited pharmacies to take orders, I developed a mobile application tailored to this workflow. The app allowed the salesperson to create purchase orders on behalf of the pharmacies they attended and receive push notifications whenever a new order was placed through the system.

This real-time synchronization helped prevent duplicate visits to pharmacies that had already placed an order on the same day, optimizing both sales operations and logistics planning.

Key Features

  • Pharmacy portal: product browsing (categories/search/sorting), cart, order creation, and order history.
  • Admin dashboard: KPIs and analytics (revenue, orders, active pharmacies, top products, sales trend, sales by category/pharmacy).
  • Order management: pending/completed views, search + pagination, status updates (e.g., delivered).
  • Invoices: admins can upload a PDF invoice when completing an order; authorized users can list and download invoices.
  • User & access management: administrators with role-based permissions (e.g., stats, orders, products, promotions, users), plus vendor, client, and pharmacy management (including pharmacy enable/disable and associations).
  • Promotions: “buy N get M” promotions tied to products, with activation toggles.
  • Salesperson mobile app: authentication, fast product search, cart-based order creation on behalf of a selected pharmacy, and viewing active orders.

title: WageWatch
shortDescription: A mobile app to help wage workers keep track of their income and detect mis matchs with the law.
fullDescription:
WageWatch – App Overview

WageWatch is a mobile app designed to help hourly workers track their work hours and paychecks, automatically check for wage discrepancies, and ensure they are being paid correctly. This app was built to help users identify underpayments, missed overtime, and potential wage violations, and even connect them with legal support when necessary.

Core Value Proposition

WageWatch empowers workers — especially those with hourly jobs in industries like construction, retail, hospitality, delivery, and healthcare — to “police their paychecks” by comparing their logged hours and agreed-upon wage rates against what they actually received. The app flags discrepancies that might indicate wage theft or underpayment, helping users better understand their pay. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

Key Features

  • Work Time Tracking: Log hours worked with weekly or monthly schedules. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}
  • Pay Verification: Upload paycheck photos and compare actual pay against logged hours and rates. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}
  • Discrepancy Alerts: Get alerts when potential wage violations are detected. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}
  • Tips & Bonuses Logging: Record additional earnings like tips to see full compensation. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}
  • Custom Break Settings: Include unpaid breaks and override automatic deductions. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}
  • Legal Support Links: Connect with legal help or union resources when discrepancies are found. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}
  • Coworker Collaboration: Explore group or class-action options with coworkers. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}
Note: To support accurate compliance checking across different U.S. states and their unique labor laws and wage requirements, we developed a powerful Rule Engine. This Rule Engine allows the system to determine which state laws apply in a given scenario and evaluate wage calculations accordingly, ensuring the user is evaluated under the correct legal framework for their location.

title: Flock
shortDescription: A swipe and match social media app to meet people with similar literature interests with you.
fullDescription:
Flock

A social reading platform that connects like-minded readers through shared books, intelligent matching, and AI-powered recommendations.

What is Flock?

Social Reading

Flock blends social media mechanics with literature discovery, allowing users to connect, chat, and grow through shared reading experiences.

Swipe & Match

Users discover other readers using a swipe-based matching system, similar to modern social apps, focused entirely on literary affinity.

AI-Driven Discovery

Every match unlocks curated reading recommendations generated specifically for both users.

Core Features

User Profiles

  • Custom avatar as profile picture
  • Personal reading history
  • Favorite books selection
  • Preferred literature genres

Matching System

  • Swipe to like or skip users
  • Match based on shared interests
  • Instant chat unlock on match

AI Recommendations

  • Generated on each successful match
  • Based on common favorite books
  • Suggests books neither user has read
  • Encourages shared reading experiences

Community Section

  • Post opinions and reviews
  • Comment on other users’ posts
  • Engage in book-centered discussions

Technical Solution

iOS Frontend

The client application is a fully native iOS app written in Swift, ensuring high performance, smooth animations, and a seamless swipe-based user experience.

Serverless Architecture

The backend is built using a serverless architecture on AWS, orchestrated with Lambda functions to handle matching, recommendations, and chat initialization.

AI-Powered Matching

When two users match, a Lambda function calls the OpenAI API to analyze both users’ common favorite books and generate a fresh list of recommended reads.

Scalable & Cost-Efficient

The serverless approach allows the platform to scale automatically with user growth while keeping infrastructure costs optimized.
publishers: Norberto Verino, Santiago Lopez de haro

title: Treds
shortDescription: A file sharing social media app oriented to organizing collections of files associated with research or brain storms.
fullDescription:
Treds

A Pinterest-like social and collaborative platform where users collect, organize, and share research, inspiration, and files within themed groups.

What is Treds?

Organized Sharing

Treds allows users to create curated spaces called Treds, where content, ideas, and files can be collected and explored together.

Flexible Privacy

Each Tred can be public, private, or collaborative, giving users full control over visibility and participation.

Research & Inspiration

Designed for users preparing trips, projects, or portfolios, Treds serves as a living archive of research and inspiration.

Core Features

Treds (Collections)

  • Create and manage themed collections
  • Public, private, or collaborative access
  • Custom title, description, and cover image
  • Membership roles and permissions

Treasures (Content)

  • Upload images, documents, and files
  • Associate treasures with one or more Treds
  • Keep treasures private if desired
  • Support for multiple file formats

Community Interaction

  • Comment on Treds
  • Engage with shared content
  • View and explore public Treds

Quick Save

  • Create treasures via MMS
  • Fast content capture without opening the app
  • Ideal for saving ideas on the go

User Authentication

Phone-Based Signup

Users authenticate using their phone number, verified securely through SMS confirmation codes.

Token-Based Security

Authentication is handled using JWT access tokens and refresh tokens to ensure secure and scalable sessions.

Technical Solution

API-Driven Backend

The platform is built around a RESTful API architecture, separating concerns between authentication, content management, and user interactions.

Main API Endpoints

  • Auth: Signup, login via SMS, refresh tokens
  • Users: Profile data, memberships, user treasures
  • Treds: CRUD operations, membership, comments, search
  • Treasures: File upload, update, delete, and association
  • Quick Save: MMS-based treasure creation

Core Entities

  • User (phone number, profile information)
  • Tred (title, description, type, image, views)
  • Treasure (file, metadata, owner, optional Tred)
  • Membership (user role within a Tred)
  • Comment (user-generated discussions)

User Flow

Users sign up or log in using their phone number and verify access via SMS. Once authenticated, they can create or join Treds, upload treasures, comment on shared content, and collaborate with others.

Quick Save via MMS enables instant content capture, making the platform especially effective for spontaneous research and inspiration gathering.
publishers: Diana Garcia, Santiago Lopez de haro

title: Payments validation micro-services
shortDescription: A group of microservices that lives on SAP BTP (Business Technology platform) that validate, back up and enrich payments data that comes from different CISCO systems as jsons or EDI Documents to then finally insert them in SAP.
fullDescription:
SAP Payment Validation & Integration Kit

A modular kit of microservices built on SAP Integration Suite to validate, enrich, and orchestrate payment processing across multiple systems.

What is this Project?

Enterprise Payment Orchestration

This project implements a set of microservices that validate payment data against different external and internal systems before securely forwarding the enriched payload to SAP.

Asynchronous & Event-Driven

The solution follows an asynchronous, event-driven architecture where SAP acts both as a consumer and a producer of events through webhooks.

Integration-Centric Design

Designed as an integration kit, the solution can be reused, extended, and adapted to support new payment validation rules and systems.

Core Capabilities

Payment Validation

  • Validate payment payloads against multiple external systems
  • Apply business and compliance rules
  • Reject or flag invalid payments early in the process

Payload Enrichment

  • Enhance incoming payment data with additional attributes
  • Merge responses from multiple validation services
  • Produce a normalized, SAP-ready payment payload

SAP Integration

  • Send validated payments to SAP systems
  • Support synchronous and asynchronous communication
  • Ensure contract-compliant payloads for SAP interfaces

Webhook Continuation Flow

  • SAP triggers a webhook after payment processing
  • Webhook invokes a downstream microservice
  • Continues post-SAP processing and orchestration

Technical Solution

SAP Integration Suite

The solution is implemented using SAP Integration Suite, leveraging its integration flows, adapters, and monitoring capabilities to manage enterprise-grade message processing.

Microservices Architecture

Each validation and enrichment responsibility is encapsulated in an independent microservice, allowing isolated deployments, scalability, and easier maintenance.

Event-Driven Processing

Payment flows are handled asynchronously, enabling parallel validation against different systems and reducing overall latency.

Secure Communication

All interactions are secured using enterprise authentication and authorization mechanisms, ensuring data integrity and compliance.

End-to-End Flow

Incoming payment requests are received by the integration layer and routed to multiple validation microservices. Each service validates and enriches the payload independently.

Once validation is complete, the enriched payment payload is sent to SAP for further processing. After SAP completes its internal logic, it triggers a webhook to a downstream microservice to continue the workflow.

Why This Architecture?

Scalability

Independent microservices scale based on validation demand without impacting the entire system.

Extensibility

New payment validation systems can be added with minimal changes to existing integrations.

Enterprise Reliability

SAP Integration Suite provides monitoring, retry mechanisms, and error handling required for mission-critical payment flows.
publishers: Diego Garrido, Santiago Lopez de haro

title: Enterprise Procurement & Supplier Collaboration Portal.
shortDescription: A group of microservices that lives on SAP BTP (Business Technology platform) that validate, back up and enrich payments data that comes from different CISCO systems as jsons or EDI Documents to then finally insert them in SAP.
fullDescription:
The Challenge

Penguin Solutions required a bridge between their internal SAP S/4HANA environment and their external supplier network. The goal was to eliminate manual communication gaps, reduce errors in Purchase Order (PO) processing, and provide a secure, real-time negotiation layer for schedule and price changes that traditional ERP interfaces often lack for external users.

The Solution

We developed a dual-facing web portal that acts as an intelligent orchestration layer. By integrating a cloud-based backend with the core ERP, we created a system that manages the entire PO lifecycle—from initial internal approval to final supplier commitment. The solution ensures that no data is written to the core SAP system until it has been fully vetted and agreed upon by all stakeholders.

Core Features

  • Automated Approval Workflow: Integrates an automated sequence (SBPA) where internal stakeholders approve or reject POs based on importance. This ensures that suppliers only see high-quality, pre-approved documents.
  • Bi-Directional Negotiation: Suppliers can 'Commit as is' or 'Request Changes' (schedules or pricing). This initiates a digital negotiation loop where buyers can accept, reject, or provide remarks, maintaining a full audit trail of the conversation.
  • Live Data Enrichment: The portal dynamically combines live ERP data with portal-specific metadata (status history and remarks), providing a comprehensive view without duplicating the entire database.
  • Intelligent Notifications: An automated email engine ensures that buyers and suppliers are alerted the moment a pending action—such as a new PO, a rejection, or a change request—requires their attention.
  • Secure Identity Management: Utilizes advanced JWT-based access control to ensure suppliers only see data relevant to their specific IDs and Purchase Groups.

How it Works

When a PO is created in SAP S/4HANA, it is intercepted and sent to our cloud layer. It enters a 'Pending for Approval' (PFA) state, moving through a sequential chain of internal approvers. Once cleared, the PO is published to the Supplier Portal.

Suppliers then interact with the PO in real-time. If changes are requested, the Buyer Portal allows internal teams to review, comment on, and ultimately approve modifications. Once a final agreement is reached, the system automatically synchronizes the updated data back to the SAP ERP via OData services, ensuring the 'Single Source of Truth' is maintained without manual entry.
publishers: Vicente Fonfria, Santiago Lopez de haro

title: Paradas AE
shortDescription: An academic project focused on optimizing public transport stops and service planning.
fullDescription:
Paradas AE is an academic project centered on optimizing public transport stop locations and service planning through data analysis and multi-objective evaluation.

Why it matters: well-placed stops reduce average walking distance, improve network coverage, increase accessibility for vulnerable users, and help balance operational costs with user experience. Optimizing stop placement directly impacts ridership, equity, and overall efficiency of the transit system.

Methodology: the problem is modeled as a multi-objective optimization task with three explicit objectives: (1) maximize passenger coverage, (2) minimize the number of active stops, and (3) minimize a demand-weighted cost that penalizes low-demand locations. Solutions are encoded as integer vectors (0–3 per segment) and evaluated using normalized objective components to make tradeoffs comparable. A Pareto-based evolutionary search (NSGA-II style) is used to obtain a set of non-dominated alternatives rather than a single point solution.

Results quality: the implementation exports multi-objective Pareto fronts with normalized metrics, enabling clear compromise solutions for decision-makers. The resulting fronts are stable across runs and show consistent improvements in coverage versus cost/stop count tradeoffs.

Repository: GitHub repo.

This work was part of the Ibero-American Congress of Puebla, Mexico on Smart Cities (ICSC CITIES 2025).
